results.title: [Wings to Vikingland]
results.brief_description: A tour of Sweden, Norway and Denmark by an American couple. The receive a traditional Swedish welcome in Stockholm; visit Lapland and the ancient city of Visby; Norway with its many fiords and mountains; the Viking and Ski Mountains; and finally Denmark - their tour of this country included visits to the royal castle, parliament building and University of Copenhagen.

results.title: [Turkey: agriculture]
results.brief_description:
A documentary on Turkish agriculture showing how machinery for farming has only recently been introduced although more primitive methods still persist. Shows tobacco farming; the farming and processing of figs and raisins; State Agriculture Institute and their interest in improving livestock; veterinary school with its own radio station; annual agriculture fair.
NB: Reel 2 only

results.title: [The Charm of Galloway]
results.brief_description: One of the most famous trains in the world “The Royal Scot” is typcial of the luxurious travel by LMS express trains. Restaurant car services are featured on all LKS Express trains to the north and the accommodation is superb.

results.title: [Sculpture]
results.brief_description: Documentation of a sculptural artwork - a series of papal deathmasks, each wearing a bishop’s mitre upon which facial features are successively more corroded and obscured. The work supports a reading that the modern Church is increasingly less consistent with its initial tenets.

results.title: [Principles of respiratory mechanics. Part I]
results.brief_description: Illustrates the mechanical behaviour of the lungs in normal and pathological states. Using animated drawings and both normal subjects and patients with respiratory conditions, discusses such basic concepts as elastic and resistive properties of the lungs and pressure volume relationships.
results.description: Illustrates the mechanical behaviour of the lungs in normal and pathological states. results.title: [Polly Woodside mast]
results.brief_description: This short film shows the activity of the National Trust of Australia’s members associated with the placing of the mast on the Polly Woodside ship which the Trust is restoring as a historical article worthy of preservation.

results.title: [Pictures of France: Savoi]
results.brief_description: Celebrated glaciers, lakes, forests and mountains including Mont Blanc provide scenic grandeur in the province of Savoi. Steamers take visitors to the spa, on Lake Geneva to drink the water and enjoy the varied sports. Wonderful views and winter sports are enjoyed by mountain-climbers and visitors, especially on the teleferry and ski-tows.

results.title: [Opening Castlemaine market] [Magnetic Soundtrack]
results.creator_credit: Bendigo and Central Victoria Telecasters Ltd
results.brief_description: Victoria’s Castlemaine market was restored by the National Trust in the early 70’s. This film records segments of the opening ceremony speeches by Victorian Premier Rupert Hamer, Australia’s Governor General John Kerr and a representative from the National Trust. Includes interior and exterior footage of the restored market and part of a photographic exhibition tracing the history of the market and the region. NB: The first five minutes and the last two minutes of the film has a magnetic soundtrack. The segment in-between is silent.
